template.name: Template Eltex MES SNMPv2 ver.2
template.description: https://github.com/AndAndr Шаблон для коммутаторов Eltex серии MES

template.name: Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2

item.name: Memory Utilization Free
item.description: The overall CPU wide system memory which is currently free in bytes.

item.name: Memory Utilization Free Percent
item.description: The overall CPU wide system memory which is currently free in percents.

item.name: Memory Total
item.description: The overall CPU wide system memory size which is currently in system.

item.name: CPU Utilization 1min
item.description: Percentage of the device CPU utilization during last minute. The value 101 is a dummy value, indicating that the CPU utilization was not measured (since measurement is disabled or was disabled during last minute).

trigger_prototype.name: Fan1 status is not OK on {HOST.NAME} StackUnit-{#SNMPVALUE}
Fan2 status is not OK on {HOST.NAME} StackUnit-{#SNMPVALUE}
Fan3 status is not OK on {HOST.NAME} StackUnit-{#SNMPVALUE}
Fan4 status is not OK on {HOST.NAME} StackUnit-{#SNMPVALUE}
Fan6 status is not OK on {HOST.NAME} StackUnit-{#SNMPVALUE}
Main power supply is not OK on {HOST.NAME} StackUnit-{#SNMPVALUE}
Redundant power supply is not OK on {HOST.NAME} StackUnit-{#SNMPVALUE}
Temperature status is not OK on {HOST.NAME} StackUnit-{#SNMPVALUE}

item_prototype.name: StackUnit-{#SNMPVALUE} Temperature sensor Warning Threshold Value

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Eltex MES SNMPv2 ver.2:rlPhdUnitEnvParamTempSensorValue[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}>{Template Eltex MES SNMPv2 ver.2:rlPhdUnitEnvParamTempSensorWarningThresholdValue[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Eltex MES SNMPv2 ver.2:rlPhdUnitEnvParamTempSensorValue[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}<{Template Eltex MES SNMPv2 ver.2:rlPhdUnitEnvParamTempSensorWarningThresholdValue[{#SNMPVALUE}].last()}-5
trigger_prototype.name: Check {HOST.NAME} StackUnit-{#SNMPVALUE} temperature

template.template: Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2
template.name: Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2
template.description: https://github.com/AndAndr Автообнаружение интерфейсов для коммутаторов Eltex серии MES.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of inbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Inbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of inbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of inbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits received
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets received on the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifInOctets. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets discarded
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The number of outbound packets which were chosen to be discarded even though no errors had been detected to prevent their being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. One possible reason for discarding such a packet could be to free up buffer space. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Outbound packets with errors
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB For packet-oriented interfaces, the number of outbound packets that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. For character-oriented or fixed-length interfaces, the number of outbound transmission units that contained errors preventing them from being deliverable to a higher-layer protocol. Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Bits sent
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The total number of octets transmitted out of the interface, including framing characters. This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Speed
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB An estimate of the interface's current bandwidth in units of 1,000,000 bits per second. If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For interfaces which do not vary in bandwidth or for those where no accurate estimation can be made, this object should contain the nominal bandwidth. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Operational status
item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {{$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} or {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}) and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

This object is a 64-bit version of ifOutOctets.Discontinuities in the value of this counter can occur at re-initialization of the management system, and at other times as indicated by the value of ifCounterDiscontinuityTime.

If this object reports a value of `n' then the speed of the interface is somewhere in the range of `n-500,000' to`n+499,999'. For a sub-layer which has no concept of bandwidth, this object should be zero.

item_prototype.description: MIB: IF-MIB The current operational state of the interface. - The testing(3) state indicates that no operational packet scan be passed - If ifAdminStatus is down(2) then ifOperStatus should be down(2) - If ifAdminStatus is changed to up(1) then ifOperStatus should change to up(1) if the interface is ready to transmit and receive network traffic - It should change todormant(5) if the interface is waiting for external actions (such as a serial line waiting for an incoming connection) - It should remain in the down(2) state if and only if there is a fault that prevents it from going to the up(1) state - It should remain in the notPresent(6) state if the interface has missing(typically, hardware) components.

trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
trigger_prototype.description:
This trigger expression works as follows: 1. Can be triggered if operations status is down. 2. {{$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}}=1 - user can redefine Context macro to value - 0. That marks this interface as not important. No new trigger will be fired if this interface is down. 3. {TEMPLATE_NAME:METRIC.diff()}=1) - trigger fires only if operational status was up(1) sometime before. (So, do not fire 'ethernal off' interfaces.)
WARNING: if closed manually - won't fire again on next poll, because of .diff.

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} or {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}) and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:lag.net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): SFP Input power
item_prototype.description: Input power on SFP interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): SFP mA
item_prototype.description: mA on SFP interface.

item_prototype.description: Out power on SFP interface.

item_prototype.description: Temperature on SFP interface.

item_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): SFP Volt
item_prototype.description: Volt on SFP interface.

trigger_prototype.expression: ({Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} or {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}>({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}) and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}>0
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.in[ifHCInOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()} and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.out[ifHCOutOctets.{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(15m)}<(({$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}-3)/100)*{Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.speed[ifHighSpeed.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High bandwidth usage ( > {$IF.UTIL.MAX:"{#IFNAME}"}% )
trigger_prototype.description: The network interface utilization is close to its estimated maximum bandwidth.

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} or {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].min(5m)}>{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}
trigger_prototype.recovery_expression: {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.in.errors[ifInErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8 and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.out.errors[ifOutErrors.{#SNMPINDEX}].max(5m)}<{$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"}*0.8
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): High error rate ( > {$IF.ERRORS.WARN:"{#IFNAME}"} for 5m)

dependency.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Link down
dependency.expression: {$IFCONTROL:"{#IFNAME}"}=1 and ({Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].last()}=2 and {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.net.if.status[ifOperStatus.{#SNMPINDEX}].diff()}=1)

trigger_prototype.expression: {Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.rlPhyTestGetResult.InPow[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}<({Template Module Eltex MES Interfaces SNMPv2:optic.rlPhyTestGetResult.OutPow[{#SNMPINDEX}].avg(5m)}*2)
trigger_prototype.name: Interface {#IFNAME}({#IFALIAS}): Затухание на SFP
